"I think that girl's ugly." Brittany curled her lip in a sneer. "I know all those guys in the audience holds up signs saying 'she's sexy', but she's REALLY not." A bag of cheetos rested on her lap, and she lifted a handful of them into her gaping mouth.

"She's fat and ugly." Brittany licked her fingers and reached for more cheetos.

"Keep eating like that, and you'll be fat too."

"Shut up!" Brittany tried not to laugh, since her mouth was still full. Brianna didn't really believe what she said. Ever since they'd met, Brittany loved food. But she could eat whatever she wanted and still stay thin. Well, tonight was going to fix that...

"Have you ever thought about being really fat?"

Brittany kept on eating and staring at the screen. She didn't seem to hear her. "Sorry...what?"

Brianna glanced over her should at the floor. The glittering magic book was poking out of her rumpled bookbag. She reached down and picked it up. "Which would you rather have...fat stomach or a fat butt?"

"Ew!" Brittany laughed again. "I dunno. Maybe..."

1351.title: Party Time!

13512.content:
Rebecca tensed as she drove up the mountain. She wasn't in any danger, the heights and lack of shoulder on the road made her nervous. She was glad to be going, but man did she hate getting there. Vanessa had invited her to her family's mountain cabin for the weekend, starting Thursday, and she had asked Rebecca to come early to show her something cool in the woods.

Rebecca pulled up to the cabin and grabbed her things from the back. She looked up at the structure, taking the fact that calling it a "Cabin" was a little misleading, it was more of a mansion. Three stories of craftsmanship stood before her as she walked up the steps and headed in, as Vanessa had told her.

"Hey girl!" Vanessa's voice echoed a bit in the large foyer. She was was taller than Rebecca, at 5'8", and about twice as wide, sporting quite the plump frame. She was quite a pear, leaving her upper body looking soft with tits smaller than Rebecca's, but her lower body put hers to shame. She was wearing a pair of jorts and a loose t-shirt as the two friends exchanged a hug. "How was the drive up?"

"Oh, you know, stressful. I've never driven up here before." Rebecca chuckled. She herself was wearing some durable capris and a blouse, opting for something more conservative for the hike, but had brought more revealing clothes for the party.

"Yea, it can be hard the first few times. Anyway, let's get you settled in, then I can show you that thing I mentioned." Vanessa led her to a room on the second floor.

"What is it?" Rebecca asked setting her things on the very comfortable looking bed, she had her own clsoet and bathroom to her own. "This place must've cost a fortune to build..." she thought to herself

"It's a surprise!" Vanessa giggled,"Let me show you around first, then we can get going." she led Rebecca back downstairs to where the kitchen was, some staff finishing up some meals to put in the fridge, "There will be plenty to eat, don't worry." Vanessa assured her with Rebecca asking, then then went out to the dining area, and back across the foyer to the lounge, movie theater, and then the game room. They went out the back door to the back porch, the view was an amazing one, with a sweeping view of the valley below. "That's the first floor. The second floor is all bedrooms, and the third floor is the gallery. It's off limits." Vanessa said as the returned to the front door.

"This view is amazing, I could stare at it forever..." Rebecca said as she leaned on the railing.

"You have all weekend to look at it, but I need to show you that thing now, follow me." Vanessa went ahead, her massive thighs sliding past each other with each step. The hike took about thirty minutes, Vanessa being a bit winded and Rebecca trying to hide that she was catching her breath.

"Damn, I'm out of shape." she thought as they approached a small cave.

"This is it." Vanessa, said, turning and facing her slimmer friend.

"A cave?"

"It's what's inside."

Vanessa led her in and pulled out her phone to use as a light, they eventually came up to a small shrine.

"Whoaaa, what is that?" Rebecca asked, pulling her own phone out to light it up. She took in the shrine, it looked ancient, cave mud covering a large part of it, in was a table with two small obelisks on each side, a figure of a large fat woman on the center of it.

"It's an Earth Mother shrine. I did some research after I first found it, they're from an ancient fertility cult that would worship women with larger bodies. A few things I read said these cults did really well, eventually becoming some of the first civilizations."

"That's so cool, why haven't you told anyone?" Rebecca inquired, both girls kneeling down to look at it.

"Because, if you find one, you can make a wish. Do you want to go first?" Vanessa asked

"I don't really believe in that kinda stuff..."

"Indulge me, please?"

"Alright alright," Rebecca laughed a little nervously. She thought for a moment, then spoke. "I wish--"

"No! It was to stay a secret." Vanessa interjected. Rebecca looked at her and apologized, then turned her attention back to the figure on the table.

"I wish for a weekend I'll never forget!" Rebecca looked back to Vanessa as she seemed to be praying, waiting for her to finish.

"Okay," Vanessa took a moment to look at the figure, taking in her gigantic curves, "Ready to head back?"

Secretly, Vanessa wished for the statue's blessing on...

153232.title: Try This One?

1532321.content:
It was a bright and sunny morning on the outskirts of Boston Massachusetts. Outside of the city, a young highway patrolwoman was laying in wait for any lawbreakers that might try to enter into the big city. Massachusetts was known for having the worst drivers in all of America and it was a busy summer day, which was bound to attract the most dangerous drivers. Angela Starwolf stood, motorcycle revving as she thought to herself. “Any minute now,” said the amazon to herself. “Somebody is going to break the law. I hate days like this, something always happens. Sometimes I wonder why I became a cop.” However, Angela knew darn well why she became a cop. In truth she had come from a family of police and she was the latest in a long line of law enforcers. Although Angela sometimes complained, she did enjoy her job and was glad that she was making a difference in the big city.

However, at that moment, a bright pink and rusty cadillac was driving down the street at rapid speed. “Whoa!” yelled Angela. “What the?!” Angela revved up her motorcycle to follow after the car that was driving clumsily down the road and had even managed to knock over a street lamp. The vehicle’s owner had also tossed out a light cigarette that Angela then ran over with her motorcycle. “Hey!” yelled the young policewoman. “You idiot! Don’t you know that’s an easy way to start a fire!” Angela put on her siren as she chased after the reckless driver who only sped up once he noticed Angela coming after him. “Oh,” said the policewoman in annoyance. “You are definitely not helping your case.”

Angela sped up and the man in the cadillac took out a gun and tried to shoot her. However, Angela had a gun herself and shot the man’s gun right out of his hand. The reckless driver screamed and attempted to turn to lose Angela, but in the process, he drove off the road and burst two of his tires. The driver tried to escape by undoing his seat belt but before he could get anywhere, he saw Angela right outside his door and she glared down on him. “Reckless driver,” she said as she wrote up the charges. “Shooting at an officer of the law...” Angela then noticed something in the back of the man’s cadillac and saw what looked like several paintings.

Out of curiosity, Angela focused on one painting in particular that depicted the burning skeleton of a whale. “The Whale’s Nightmare,” said Angela. “That was one of several paintings stolen from the Museum of Modern Art last week.” The driver tried to exit out of the passenger side of the vehicle but it was no use because Angela already handcuffed him. “Every single piece in this car is hot,” she said. “You just wrote your own guilty verdict.” It wasn’t long until Angela called for backup to arrest the art smuggler.

- - - - - -

Soon, Angela was talking with the police lieutenant as the art smuggler was loaded in the paddy wagon. “You’d think that somebody who stole a priceless painting would try to keep a lower profile.” Said the lieutenant with a laugh. “Lieutenant Steel,” said Angela. “If these people were any smart, they wouldn’t be criminals to begin with.” “I guess so,” said Lieutenant Steel to himself. “But it doesn’t help their case that you’re always vigilant.” Angela gave a scoff. “I’m a Starwolf,” she said. “It’s what I do.” It was there Angela noticed two paintings in particular that were covered up, unlike the other paintings. “Huh?” asked Angela. “Why are these two paintings the only ones wrapped up?” “I don’t know,” said Lieutenant Steel. “If the guy didn’t want to be caught, he should’ve covered all the paintings in this car. We’re not dealing with a rocket scientist here.”

Angela looked closely at the two covered up painting and then out of curiosity, she lifted the tarp covering both of the paintings what she saw puzzled her. The first painting depicted a manatee dressed in a seashell bikini and swinging on a large swing that appeared to be directly over the ocean. The other painting depicted a hippopotamus dressed as a Hawaiian goddess and sitting atop a large volcano. “Huh,” said Angela. “These are a couple of odd looking paintings. Erk!” Angela suddenly felt her head and stepped back. “You okay, Starwolf?” asked Lieutenant Steel. Angela breathed in and breathed out before she spoke. “Oh,” she said. “I’m fine, Lieutenant. I just felt light headed all of a sudden.”

Lieutenant Steel nodded his head. “Well. You already caught your crook for today. Why don’t you break for lunch.” Angela nodded her head. “I am feeling a little empty-stomached. Thanks, Lieutenant.” With that, Angela drove off to break for lunch. As she was driving, Angela felt her stomach as it gurgled loudly. “Geez,” she said. “I should never have skipped breakfast today.” What Angela didn’t realize was that is wasn’t just hunger that was the reason why her stomach was growling. Her stomach was bulging slightly bigger and her jeans were tightening on her body.

However, her waistline was the last thing on Angela’s mind. She was too hungry to give it much thought and she decided to stop off and eat at...
1532321.title: Dawn Patrol

15323211.content:
Angela decided to eat out at a pizzeria. Normally she wasn’t one to go overboard when it came to junk food, but for some reason she was ravenously devouring an entire meat lover’s pizza. She already swallowed three slices before she dug into some fries. “Dang,” thought Angela to herself as she kept stuffing her face, stopping only to suck up some soda. “I must’ve been more hungry than I thought. It feels like no matter how much I eat, it’s never enough. Maybe I’ve been working too hard. I haven’t really been eating much over the past few days. All this shedding for the wedding must be getting to me. But I want to be in the best shape I can. I gotta fit the dress.”

Suddenly, as Angela was shoveling food in her mouth, her phone begun to ring. “Hello?” asked Angela as she held the phone to her ear. “Hey, Angie,” said a male voice on the phone. “I heard what happened. Great work on the bust this morning.” Angela recognized that voice. It was her fiancé, Bill. Hearing his voice made her smile. “Hey, Bill. Only two more months.” “I still can’t believe I scored a prize like you, Baby. What you could see in somebody who looks like me, I’ll never understand. Where are you right now, Angela?” Angela bit into a piece of pizza, completely unaware that her chair was breaking beneath her and the buttons were popping off of her jacket as her breasts and belly got bigger. “I’m at Lenny’s Pizzeria,” said Angela. “I’m so hungry all of a sudden.” “Pizza?” asked Bill. “That’s funny. You don’t usually like to binge on greasy food. Is everything okay.” Angela let out a slight belch before she spoke again. “I’m sure it’s nothing to wor... oh!”

Before Angela could finish her sentence, her chair broke and she fell to the ground with a loud boom. “Ow!” “Angela?” asked Bill. “Are you alright?” Angela got up and saw the cracks in the floor and her broken chair before she looked down in shock because of how big her belly had become. “Oh my gosh!” yelled Angela. “I’m huge!” Bill didn’t understand at first. “Well, you’re nearly 7 feet tall.” “No,” said Angela. “You’re not going to believe this Bill, but I’d say I put on at least 100lbs.” Angela staggered outside and then poked her stomach. “You can’t be serious,” said Bill. “Even if you did stop for pizza, it wouldn’t make you so titanically fat immediately.” But Angela was sure something was up because now she had the build of a sumo wrestler and felt her chin to learn that it had doubled.

It was there Angela heard a ripping noise and the young policewoman turned around and looked in shock because her butt had expanded to the point where it was at least five feet wide and had tore through her jeans, exposing her underwear and forcing her to cover up her massive rear with her hands. As Angela was trying to wrap her head around her sudden mass weight gain, she looked in horror at her reflection in a nearby window because it was clear that she had a different problem.

Her face no longer looked human and if she didn’t know better, Angela would’ve sworn that she was transforming into an anthropomorphic...
15323211.title: The Magic Happens

Her skin even looked darker.. more brown like she tanned heavily, but almost greyish She looked...almost like....a hippopotamus.
"Aaaaaaaahhhgh!" she yelled. When she opened her mouth she saw her teeth were yellow and blocky while her two incisors were starting to elongate and curve into two yellowed tusks. Angela heard more ripping noises, she glanced down to see her voluptuous breasts were swelling in her shirt, straining the fabric as the sagged onto her growing belly.

153232222.content:
How about this girl? Gwen is a thin 18 year old brunnete who wears her hair in a ponytail. She is an ardent health advocate and works at the university's gym. She is studying to be a nutritionist. But now at college Gwen is exposed to a more lax lifestyle creating new urges.

She was put up for adoption as a baby and adopted by fitness nuts (turns out the woman's vigorous dieting had made her infertile) who raised Gwen in a fitness environment. But Gwen's real mother was an obese glutton. As Gwen reaches womanhood her mother's genetics are beginning to show themselves.
